sub_title: Entrepreneurial and Transformational Leader • CEO Renault Group Netherlands • Automotive Globetrotter
summary:
«Our spirit of innovation takes mobility further to bring people closer». Renault Group is on a journey to become a clean energy, tech and mobility services company.

An agile, energetic, innovative, optimistic and pragmatic leader, who champions a growth mindset and thrives on new opportunities; from creating significant sales, customer satisfaction and profit results to growing the business. Having worked for both manufacturer and retail businesses, there is unique insight of the true value of both ends of the business which enables the proven ability to create highly effective working relationships.

Career is highlighted by two common threads: a willingness to take ‘responsible risks’ and to say ‘yes’ to every (global) opportunity. This has led to great 🙌 things and great 🌎 places. Audentes fortuna iuvat. Lived in: 🇳🇱🇺🇸🇨🇴🇧🇪🇸🇪🇪🇸🇷🇺🇨🇭🇩🇪🇱🇺🇦🇺, worked and visited over 35 countries and counting!

Awarded Permanent Residency in Australia: Global Talent visa, subclass 858. This is a permanent visa for people who have an internationally recognised record of exceptional and outstanding achievement in an eligible field.

education.field_of_study: Business Administration and Management, Stockholm and Shanghai

education.degree_name: Strategy in the Age of Digital Disruption

awards.title: Global Talent visa (subclass 858)
awards.description:
The Global Talent visa is one of the more interesting and unique visas to Australia, offering permanent residency to individuals who have an “internationally recognised record of exceptional and outstanding achievement” in an eligible area.
The purpose of this visa is to attract highly skilled/talented individuals in their field to come to Australia, where they would elevate Australia’s standards internationally, introduce or transfer skills to Australia, elevate Australia’s competitiveness and reputation, and/or make a significant positive cultural or social impact on the community.

https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/global-talent-visa-858
awards.issuer: Australian Government Department of Home Affairs

projects.title: Volvo Art Session
projects.description: Volvo Art Session is the national, annual brand event of Volvo Car Switzerland. The Volvo Art Session (VAS) was first held in 2011 with the aim of presenting a broader Swiss public Volvo Cars’ new brand values Design and Innovation. Young artists interacted -in the middle of the busy Zurich main station -on a stage with a current Volvo model and a white canvas. The Volvo Art Session progressed to become a platform for Innovation, Art and Design. Like the modern Volvo, the national event deals with the topic “human meets digital”. The Volvo Art Session addresses the target group of influencers, opinion leaders and top-tier media and aims to position Volvo as THE leader in the field of "human centric innovation".

contributors.headline: Entrepreneurial and Transformational Leader • CEO Renault Group Netherlands • Automotive Globetrotter
Head of Brand, Communications & Marketing | Strategy Development & Implementation | Corporate Sustainability | Business Development & Transformation | People Management & Development | Storytelling
Co - Owner and Managing Director EQAL Visual Productions AG

profile_positions.description:
Direct Sales, Import and Distribution.
”To improve is to change. To perfect is to change often”. 
⏱ «Revolution» final phase 3. Acting daily as an agent for change helping to turn Renault Group into a “next-gen automotive company” and make it more innovative and agile.
✅ «Renovation» phase 2. Feeding brands' strength, each with own clear, differentiated territories (Renault, Dacia, Alpine, Møbilize). Phase 2 is well underway, with a set of impressive products coming to the roads very soon.
✅ «Resurrection» phase 1 of the «Renaulution» strategic action plan. Renault Group's global strategy is an ambitious transformative program, moving from volumes to value. Phase 1 focused on margin and cash generation recovery.
profile_positions.title: Chief Executive Officer 🇳🇱 Netherlands

profile_positions.description: Import and Distribution | Leadership of the Australian subsidiary for Renault & Alpine. Achieved an impressive business turnaround for Australia. Prepared for acquisition and transitioned to an independent distributorship from April 1, 2021.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director 🇦🇺 Australia

profile_positions.description:
Began career at the United Nations in New York. Moved to Brussels as a researcher at a boutique consultancy firm. Then changed to automotive. Held various marketing roles across European markets (Spain, Belgium, Switzerland, Sweden) for some years. Became sales & marketing manager for overseas markets (Turkey, Russia, UAE, S-America, S-Africa, Asia). Moved to Moscow in 2003 and progressed to VP Sales & Marketing, Premier Automotive Group (Volvo Jaguar Landrover), division of Ford (NYSE: F) of Russia. 
Moved to Zürich in 2009 and headed Volvo Cars Switzerland and its retail subsidiary through several years of expansion and the challenges of the € crisis. Switched to retail full-time in 2014, moved to Luxembourg and became Operations Director (COO) of multi-brand dealerships in France, Belgium and Luxembourg, ranking amongst EU Top 50 biggest dealership groups. Joined Inchcape plc (LON: INCH) and moved ‘down under’ early 2017 as Executive Board Director Australia/NZ and headed the newly established local Peugeot Citroën organization, division of Inchcape Australasia, through its turnaround period as the new PSA independent distributor. 
Switched to Renault Group (EPA: RNO) in 2019.
profile_positions.title: From 🌏 Trainee to MD

volunteer_experiences.description: RAI Association represents the interests of enterprises in the area of mobility in The Netherlands. On behalf of Renault Group Nederland representing Renault, Dacia, Alpine and Møbilize brands/OEMs in The Netherlands.

The mission of ILA is to promote the profession of Directors by developing its members into highly qualified, effective and respected Directors. Go-to-market leader, business builder and (board) advisor supporting early stage ILA member businesses with fast track progress.
International member ILA since 2017.

Australia's independent and trusted organisation for directors and business leaders, dedicated to improving the quality of governance and directorship. Senior executive director and member of local Australian Boards. 
International member GAICD since 2021.

Scale is a female focused member based angel investory network founded in Melbourne in March 2013 and inspired by the US based organisation Golden Seeds. Our mission is to equip women to become successful investors whose wealth is enhanced through connection with, investment in, and coaching and support of entrepreneurs in early stage businesses. Go-to-market leader; supporting early stage member businesses with fast track progress.
www.scaleinvestors.com.au/scale-angel-network

Our mission is to transform Australia into a more powerful magnet for marquee enterprises and exceptional individuals so we can reap the benefit of their ideas, capital, talent and networks.

volunteer_experiences.description: FACCI, affiliated to CCI France International, is an independent NFP organisation comprising more than 600 members in Australia. FACCI's main mission is to promote its members and support the exchanges between French & Australian companies through information, networking and business support services.
